content: The theory of relativity, E=mc^2, was proposed by which physicist who won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921?

That would be Albert Einstein. He's one of the most famous scientists in history, known not only for his theory of relativity but also for his contributions to other areas of physics. The equation E=mc² is part of his theory of special relativity, which he published in 1905. This theory fundamentally changed our understanding of space and time. Later, in 1915, he introduced the theory of general relativity, which is our current description of gravity. Einstein's work has had a profound impact on modern physics and technology.
